post.author: NSF001
post.body: Hi guys, just want to create a weapon sound mod for WF2009 SP, but I don't know where these sound located...anyone can help? I know these sounds been storaged in one of those spk files， but which one？

post.author: =FF=Sturm
post.body:
Welcome to Doom 3 world!
You can locate them in the MP folder (not sp), inside the pk4 files.
As far as I know, there isn't a spk/mpk fully* working exporter. You could only export music/models and some stuff.

post.author: vertex007
post.body:
hi,

look here

viewtopic.php?f=68&t=23093&st=0&sk=t&sd=a

user bellox created a extractor back then...I was able to mod some sounds with it...

I can't really remember the details because I never touched wolf09 again...

I checked if I still have the extractor but it seems it got lost when I changed my PC....

may check some backups still....but can't promise anything...

post.author: NSF001
post.body:
vertex007 wrote:
hi,

look here

viewtopic.php?f=68&t=23093&st=0&sk=t&sd=a

user bellox created a extractor back then...I was able to mod some sounds with it...

I can't really remember the details because I never touched wolf09 again...

I checked if I still have the extractor but it seems it got lost when I changed my PC....

may check some backups still....but can't promise anything...


Thanks vertex007, I've found those sound files in 'SP\base\maps\game\global\global.spk', and I successfully extracted it with SPK MPK Extractor， but it seems the SPK MPK Extractor can only repack mp3 files, if I only repack those mp3s in a separated .spk and put it into the 'streampacks' folder, will the game load it automatically？

post.author: vertex007
post.body:
you should try to replace the files....
find the soundfile you want to change, replace it with yours but without changing name/structure, then repack into the original spk and see if it works, of course you should make back up of the original folder/spk...just in case...

sorry, as already said I worked with this stuff years ago, don't remember exactly the details of how it really worked out...but I think you should be able to accomplish what you want....game is not really moddable, it's all workarounds and tricks...
